intro: Aosa gilgiana, commonly known as the Gilgian aosa, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are typically broad and oval, with a rough texture and prominent veins. Aosa gilgiana is often found in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to cooler, high-altitude environments.
